info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 11 at 11:58AM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado...
San Juan River at Pagosa Springs affecting Archuleta County.
For the San Juan River...including Pagosa Springs...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...San Juan River at Pagosa Springs.
* WHEN...From this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, Water is flowing over the yards of homes in the San Juan River Village northeast of Pagosa Springs. At 11.0 feet, Water will approach the area around the River Center shopping complex in Pagosa Springs. Inundation of sections of Hermosa Street and low land areas adjacent to the river can be expected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to potentially reach minor flood stage due to recent rainfall. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gjt.
The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 300 PM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
